Issues.Title: Replace hardcoded backslashes with Path.DirectorySeparatorChar and fix WinFX casing (daviddenis-stx, Nirmal4G, PaulEremeeff)
Issues.Body:
This includes @daviddenis-stx's Path.DirectorySeparatorChar fixes and the first two commits from @Nirmal4G and @PaulEremeeff to fix WinFX casing. (Thank you!)

The issue is described in more detail in PRs #2877 and #2975.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace hardcoded backslashes with Path.DirectorySeparatorChar and fix WinFX casing (daviddenis-stx, Nirmal4G, PaulEremeeff)" (#3101)

Issues.Title: WPF App crashes due to COMException (UCEERR_RENDERTHREADFAILURE) from System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel.SyncFlush
Issues.Body:
Problem description:  HostVisual interacts with its rendering channel on the wrong thread.  This can lead to render thread failures, perhaps minutes or hours after the bad interaction.

[Port of servicing fix for .NET 4.7-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF App crashes due to COMException (UCEERR_RENDERTHREADFAILURE) from System.Windows.Media.Composition.DUCE.Channel.SyncFlush" (#3100)

Issues.Title: SplashScreen not centered when the size for apps and text is not set to 100%
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.4
* Windows version 10 1909 & 2004
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Not tested.
 
 **Problem description:**
When UHD & 4K monitors are used, text is usually so small that users normally *change the size of apps and text* **to a value larger** than the 100% recommended value. This can be changed in Settings -> Display. When this setting is not the default 100%, SplashScreen does not appear centered in the screen.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6704109/83767483-ffbe3600-a67d-11ea-866d-d299a7df978c.png)

  **Actual behavior:**
Under the former scenario SplashScreen of a WPF App (.NET Core) does not appear in the center of the screen.

 **Expected behavior:**
According the documentation at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.splashscreen?view=netcore-3.1
> The SplashScreen class displays the splash screen as soon as possible after the application is started. The splash screen is displayed by using native code, before the WPF application instance is created. **The splash screen is displayed in the center of the screen.** When the application is loaded, the splash screen fades.

**Minimal repro:**
Using Visual Studio 2019, create a new project/solution of the **WPF App (.NET Core)** type. Add an image to the project and under its Properties set Compilation Action as **SplashScreen**. There really is no coding involved at all, just adding an image and set it up properly.

Then change your display settings and set the above-mentioned configuration to any value larger than 100% and run the application. The SplashScreen will not appear on the center of the screen.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SplashScreen not centered when the size for apps and text is not set to 100%" (#3090)

Issues.Title: WPF TextBlock FailFast in System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.IsAtCaretUnitBoundary when TextWrapping="Wrap" and inconsistent text display (missing text)
Issues.Body:
Problem description:  In TextBlock with word-wrapping, certain strings lead to disappearing text, and FailFast exceptions during editing operations.
 
[Port of servicing bug for .NET 4.7-4.8]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF TextBlock FailFast in System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock.IsAtCaretUnitBoundary when TextWrapping="Wrap" and inconsistent text display (missing text)" (#3099)

Issues.Title: Add Microsoft.Expression.Drawing
Issues.Body:
Can the source code of Microsoft.Expression.Drawing be added to this (or another OSS) repository. It contains Shapes classes like: Arc, Arrows, Callouts, Hexagon, Pentagon, Ring, Star and triangle. 

I would love to have them in .NET Core and WinUI too.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9335559/84004285-9b47f300-a96b-11ea-9759-caf8b1238dac.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add Microsoft.Expression.Drawing" (#3097)

Issues.Title: [release/5.0-preview6] Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support
Issues.Body:
Cherry-pick of https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/3092 to the 5.0 Preview 6 branch to unblock Preview 6.

cc: @rladuca @fabiant3 @ryalanms @AaronRobinsonMSFT @jeffschwMSFT
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/5.0-preview6] Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support" (#3094)

Issues.Title: Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support
Issues.Body:
Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support by copying over portions of C#/WinRT and slimming down the projected interfaces.

Ryland and I did ad-hoc testing of the spell checker component and it worked.

Once we believe this is ready for merge, I'll cherry-pick it for release/5.0-preview6.

cc: @rladuca @fabiant3 @ryalanms @AaronRobinsonMSFT @jeffschwMSFT
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove dependency on built-in WinRT support" (#3092)

Issues.Title: the IsHitTestVisible Property doesn't work
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:  3.1.300
* Windows version:  window10 professional  2004

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 
```

<Window x:Class="DivergenceMeter.MainWindow"
        WindowStyle="None" 
        ResizeMode="NoResize" 
        AllowsTransparency="True"  
        Background="Transparent" 
        IsHitTestVisible="False"
        >
```

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25658690/83647847-f4b8c680-a5e7-11ea-8276-f35c6349c565.gif)

 **Expected behavior:**

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25658690/83647874-fbdfd480-a5e7-11ea-9c8d-152c7f3c2d04.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "the IsHitTestVisible Property doesn't work" (#3088)
